page.title: 20MILVERTON REMEMBERED
page.content:
MR CANNIFORD HAS LIVED IN MILVERTON SINCE HE WAS A LITTLE BOY. THERE HAVE BEEN LOTS OF CHANGES SINCE THEN. HE SAID PEOPLE HAD NO CARS IN THOSE DAYS. THE ONLY PERSON WHO HAD A CAR WAS MR KNIGHT AT THE WHITE HART HOTEL. OTHER PEOLE HAD PONY TRAPS. MARKET DAY WAS ON THURSDAYS IN THE SQUARE. THE BIG HOUSE OLANDS HAD A CARRIAGE AND 4 HORSES.
THE CHILDREN MADE THEIR OWN FUN. THERE WERE PONY GYMKHANAS. THERE WERE FAIRS TOO AND ATHLETICS. HE WENT TO MILVERTON SCHOOL BUT THEN IT WAS DIVIDED INTO 3 CLASSES, INFANTS, GIRLS AND BOYS. THE BOYS CLASS WAS NEVER ALLOWED UP THE STEPS TO THE GIRLS. THERE USED TO BE A POLICE STATION. EVERYONE WENT TO THE PICTURES BY THE GOODS TRAIN, WHICH DOES NOT RUN ANY MORE.
